verses.kjv: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.
verses.ct: These are the sayings of King Lemuel — an oracle that his mother taught him.

verses.kjv: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?
verses.ct: "Listen, my son! My own child! The son I dedicated to God!

verses.kjv: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.
verses.ct: Don't waste your energy on women, or your efforts on those who ruin kings.

verses.kjv: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:
verses.ct: It's not appropriate for kings, Lemuel — it's not appropriate for kings to drink wine, or for rulers to crave alcohol,

verses.kjv: Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.
verses.ct: because they might drink and forget what the law requires, and deny justice to those who are suffering.

verses.kjv: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.
verses.ct: Give alcohol to someone who is dying, and wine to those who are deeply distressed.

verses.kjv: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.
verses.ct: Let them drink and forget their hardship, and no longer dwell on their suffering.

verses.kjv: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.
verses.ct: Speak up for those who cannot speak for themselves — defend the rights of all who are helpless.

verses.kjv: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.
verses.ct: Speak up, judge fairly, and stand up for the rights of the poor and those in need."

verses.kjv: Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.
verses.ct: Who can find a woman of strong character? She is worth far more than rubies.

verses.kjv: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.
verses.ct: Her husband has complete confidence in her, and he lacks nothing of value.

verses.kjv: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.
verses.ct: She brings him good and never harm throughout her entire life.

verses.kjv: She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.
verses.ct: She finds wool and flax, and works with her hands eagerly.

verses.kjv: She is like the merchants’ ships; she bringeth her food from afar.
verses.ct: She is like trading ships, bringing her food from distant places.

verses.kjv: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.
verses.ct: She gets up while it's still dark, provides meals for her family, and assigns tasks to her servant girls.

verses.kjv: She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
verses.ct: She evaluates a field and purchases it; with her own earnings she plants a vineyard.

verses.kjv: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.
verses.ct: She prepares herself with strength and makes her arms powerful.

verses.kjv: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.
verses.ct: She recognizes that her business is profitable; her lamp stays lit through the night.

verses.kjv: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.
verses.ct: She puts her hands to the spinning wheel and grips the spindle with her fingers.

verses.kjv: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
verses.ct: She reaches out her hand to the poor; yes, she extends her hands to those in need.

verses.kjv: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.
verses.ct: She doesn't worry about winter for her family, because everyone in her household has warm clothing.

verses.kjv: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.
verses.ct: She makes her own bed coverings; her clothes are fine linen and purple fabric.

verses.kjv: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.
verses.ct: Her husband is respected at the city gates, where he sits among the leaders of the land.

verses.kjv: She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.
verses.ct: She makes linen garments and sells them, and supplies belts to the merchants.

verses.kjv: Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.
verses.ct: Strength and dignity are what she wears, and she faces the future with confidence.

verses.kjv: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.
verses.ct: When she speaks, her words are wise, and her instruction is full of kindness.

verses.kjv: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
verses.ct: She carefully watches over everything in her household and never gives in to laziness.

verses.kjv: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.
verses.ct: Her children stand up and call her blessed; her husband does the same, praising her:

verses.kjv: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.
verses.ct: "Many women have accomplished great things, but you surpass them all."

verses.kjv: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.
verses.ct: Charm can be misleading, and beauty fades away, but a woman who is wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD — she will be praised.

verses.kjv: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.
verses.ct: Reward her for everything she has accomplished, and let her work speak for itself publicly.
